abstract: Over four dozen current and former employees of Wounded Warrior Project, largest and fastest-growing veterans charity in country, say organization has spent lavishly on its employees, and on lobbying and public relations campaigns in effort to fight restrictions on amount charities can spend on overhead; project spent around 40 percent of $124 million in donations it received in 2014 on overhead.
lead_paragraph: The charity, which raised $372 million in 2015, has embraced aggressive styles of fund-raising, marketing and management — and has spent a significant proportion on overhead.

headline.main: Wounded Warrior Project Spends Lavishly on Itself, Insiders Say
headline.print_headline: Helping Veterans Recover, Spending Lavishly on Itself

snippet: The charity, which raised $372 million in 2015, has embraced aggressive styles of fund-raising, marketing and management — and has spent a significant proportion on overhead.
